title: Test none for status
tip: This doesnt have a challenge associated with it.

title: Raising Preflop1
tip: Raise with strong starting cards to win more money. It will also allow you to play against fewer opponents, increasing your chances of winning.

title: Starting Hands Overview
tip: Play hands where both cards work together pairs, two high cards or two connecting cards of the same suit. Avoid low unconnected cards of different suits.

title: Folding the Flop
tip: If you don't hit a pair or a draw on the first three cards, it's probably best to fold and wait for a better hand.
challengeCriteria: Fold a pocket pair from UTG

title: Why Slow play is bad
tip: Try to play big pots with strong hands and small pots with weak hands. With a strong hand make lots of bets and raises to win as much money as possible.

title: Preflop Betsizing
tip: If you want to raise with good starting cards, the best raise size is 3 or 4 times the size of the big blind, regardless of the strength of your hand.

title: Introduction to the Academy
tip: You will receive tips based on your play. Reviews each tip you've received and free poker lessons in the poker school on the homepage
